node.title: Ghislaine Maxwell's jail conditions rival Hannibal Lecter's, lawyer claims
node.alt: A court illustration show Ghislaine Maxwell in handcuffs and wearing a facemask being sat a chair by a man in a suit.
node.description: The lawyer for the British socialite accused of enabling Jeffrey Epstein's sexual offences has compared her jail conditions to those of the fictional serial killer and cannibal featured in Silence of the Lambs.
node.content:
["Ghislaine Maxwell has endured jail conditions comparable to Hannibal Lecter's in the 1991 film The Silence of the Lambs,\u00a0her lawyer claims.", "Lawyer\u00a0Bobbi Sternheim\u00a0offered the assessment as she renewed Ms Maxwell's request for bail ahead of her November\u00a029 trial.", "She called the British socialite's 16 months at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn \"reprehensible and utterly inappropriate for [a]\u00a0woman on the cusp of turning 60 with no criminal record or history of violence\".", "\"The surveillance rivals scenes of Dr\u00a0Hannibal Lecter's incarceration despite the absence of the cage and plastic face guard,\" Ms Sternheim wrote.", "Ms Maxwell, 59, has pleaded not guilty to sex trafficking and other charges for helping recruit and groom underage girls for Jeffrey Epstein to abuse between 1994 and 2004.", "Lecter is a fictional serial killer who eats his victims. Anthony Hopkins won an Oscar for best actor by portraying him in The Silence of the Lambs.", "", "
Anthony Hopkins starred as Lecter in three films: The Silence of the Lambs, Hannibal, and Red Dragon.(imdb.com)
", "The Manhattan office of US attorney Damian Williams, which is prosecuting Ms Maxwell, declined to comment.", "Ms Maxwell likely faces an uphill battle for bail given US\u00a0District Judge Alison Nathan, who is overseeing\u00a0her case, has rejected it three times, calling her a \"significant risk of flight\".", "A federal appeals court has also rejected bail.", "Epstein died in a Manhattan jail in August 2019 while awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges, in what a medical examiner called a suicide.", "Ms Sternheim cited several factors behind Ms Maxwell\u00a0renewing her proposed $US28.5 million ($38.3\u00a0million)\u00a0bail package, which also includes\u00a0offers to renounce her non-US\u00a0citizenships and move most of her and her husband's assets into a separate account.", "The\u00a0factors, which Ms Maxwell's lawyers have previously complained about, include alleged abuse by jail guards, unsanitary living conditions, a bad diet, sleep deprivation, and an inability to review documents for trial.", "A representative for the federal Bureau of Prisons did not immediately respond to a request for comment.", "Prospective jurors will today\u00a0begin filling out questionnaires to assess whether they can fairly judge Ms Maxwell, who faces up to 80 years in prison if convicted.", "Her trial is expected to last about six weeks.\u00a0", "Reuters"]
